Title: Data Governance Lead (Data)Preferred Location: Fully RemoteReports to: Head of Data EngineeringAbout The RoleWe are the largest influencer-driven shopping platform. As the Data Governance Lead, you will be part of a growth-hungry, acceleration-minded team of problem-solvers and product-builders. This is an opportunity to grow with a fast-growing organization. We thrive in an extremely dynamic competitive environment. We focus relentlessly on the needs of our influencers and consumers. We are seeking a Data Governance leader who can help us mature the integrity, taxonomy, governance, and underlying processes that shape our most critical enterprise data assets needed for understanding our business and building data-driven products. We seek an experienced data leader who can collaborate effectively with platform technology owners, business stakeholders, and the data engineering and data science teams to drive data ownership, accountability, and continuous data process improvement, as measured by the integrity, richness, and usability of our enterprise data domains.Is This You?The Ideal Candidate Will Have The FollowingYou are passionate with a deep understanding of how to optimize data processes for enterprise valueYou have proven experience standing up effective data governance and data management organizational processesYou have specialized experience working with retail data domains, data sharing with affiliate networks, eCommerce, product data, and clickstream dataYou can think outside the box, navigate complexity, and effectively drive work forward with clarity and business impactYou have a good balance between rolling up your sleeves and technical acumen and strategic process thinkingYou have empathy and intellectual humility and can easily build strong rapport and thought-partnershipsKey ResponsibilitiesActively drive and support the definition and enablement of the LTK Data Catalog which consists of enterprise data domains, sub-domains, models, measures, attributes, and data services available to the organizationParticipate in the definition and design of LTK domain services and taxonomies, working directly with our product owners and engineering teams and bringing a holistic and strategic perspectiveEstablish organizational data ownership and help formalize data stewardship processes (both automated and manual) that are aligned to strategic priorities and key initiativesPartner with Privacy and Security teams to understand and determine how best to adhere to data policies while also optimizing business value and productivity of our employees and engineersProvide thought leadership and optimization of 3rd party data management processes, data sharing, and key decisions affecting TCOPrioritize key data issues by data domain and work with product owners and business owners to align priorities and incorporate strategies into business and engineering roadmapsTake a proactive role to identify and address critical data activities on key initiatives related to the integrity and management of enterprise dataWork directly with the data product owner to align key data management needs with data lake releases and sprint schedulesMinimum QualificationsBachelor’s or Master’s degree; your major can be anything - we love diverse educational backgrounds, but you have a strong quantitative foundationDemonstrable record of professional and academic achievements10+ years of data-related professional experiences (data lakes and data warehousing, master data management, cloud data architectures, data research, data analysis, etc.)5+ years of work experience focused in data governance and data management leadershipStrong expertise in modern domain design principles, analytical dimensional modeling best practices, and data modeling approaches for modern software developmentMultiple program-level experiences helping organizations put in place effective data governance, data management, and data stewardship/data integrity processes that drive resultsStrong, effective communication and presence is a must at all levels of the organizationStrong influencing and negotiating skills and ability to work across organizational boundariesUnderstanding of modern data architectures and approachesStrong SQL skills and ability to perform data discovery and data profiling activities directlyPreferred SkillsUnderstanding of industry data standardsStrong conviction and understanding of best practice data management approaches balanced with the ability to implement realistic solutions that drive value quicklyExperience working with multiple product lines, tech platforms, and/or business unitsExperience working through internationalization of data (multi-currency, multi-language)Experience managing projects and programs using an agile/scrum methodology3-5+ years of relevant industry experience (retail, consumer products, marketing, etc.) working with relevant technologies and data domains (eCommerce, MarTech, CRM, 3rd party data exchange, retail product data, consumer product data, advertiser/brand/retailer product data)Certification in one or more data management disciplines a plus (MDM, CDMP, DGSP, GDPR, PII, etc.)What's in it for you as a team member at LTK? At LTK, we believe in taking care of our team members and offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical, dental, and vision, paid maternity and paternity leave and a 401k retirement plan with a LTK matching contribution. To make sure our employees stay healthy and balanced, we also offer wellness benefits such as a flexible work schedule plus Summer Fridays (Workday ends at 3pm). We don’t forget to have fun either with virtual company happy hours and virtual team events! And last but not least, you get to work on interesting problems that will help disrupt the retail industry!What you have to look forward to when you work or visit for team huddles at a LTK Office: Fully stocked bars and kitchen (free snacks all day!) Catered meals weekly Monthly Chair massagesLaidback office environment Monthly themed Happy Hours! Free access to state of the art gym while working in or visiting our Dallas HQFree Covered Parking on-site while working in or visiting our Dallas HQAbout UsAs the founder of creator guided shopping, LTK is the trusted and effective platform for creators and their businesses by powering the connection between content and commerce. Founded in 2011 by Amber and Baxter Box, the LTK mission is to empower creators to be as economically successful as possible. World premium lifestyle creators in 150+ countries drive more than $3.6 billion in annual retail sales through their LTK Creator Shop profiles. Today, more than 18 million consumers turn to LTK Creator Shops in the LTK shopping platform each month to find inspiration and instantly shop the styles recommended by their favorite creators. And, more than 6,000 brands partner with LTK to gain access to its global creator network for content that converts against performance-driven, cross-channel KPIs. A three-time honoree on Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Retail Companies, LTK is headquartered in Dallas, TX and currently operates on five continents. To download the LTK shopping app, search for LTK in the App Store or Google Play.For the latest LTK Creator updates, follow LTK.HQ, and for the latest shopping trends and updates from LTK, follow Shop.LTK.For US-Based Roles: We are not offering new sponsorships opportunities at this time for persons requiring employment visas, such as an H-1B; authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment.Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of LTK are considered the property of LTK and are not subject to payment of agency fees.LTK is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
